verb.description: Become or make smaller in size or amount; contract or cause to contract.
examples: the summer sun had shrunk and dried the wood
the workforce has shrunk to less than a thousand

verb.description: Move back or away, especially because of fear or disgust.
examples: she shrank away from him, covering her face
he shrank back against the wall

noun.description: A clinical psychologist, psychiatrist, or psychotherapist.

origin: Old English scrincan, of Germanic origin; related to Swedish skrynka to wrinkle.
